alert.note: Alert for Western Grant; Western Pendleton (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued May 03 at 1:34AM EDT until May 03 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches above 3000 feet, with localized amounts of 8 inches around 4000 feet. Accumulations of a coating to a few inches between 2000 and 3000 feet. Winds gusting 30 to 45 mph. * WHERE...Western Grant and Western Pendleton Counties. * WHEN...Until 10 AM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of heavy wet snow, strong winds, and green up on trees will enhance the threat for downed trees and power outages above 3000 feet. Sub-freezing temperatures are expected overnight. Visibility could be reduced to a half mile or less at times.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
